website_summaries.verdict: 12-sided fidget "cube" (dodecagon) with multiple diversions for excess energy and resulting loss of focus.
pros: Relieves anxiety/stress and mood issues for those with ADHD, ADD, OCD, and autism
Has multiple fidgeting options including gear, rotating disc, button, silicone ball, joystick, and worry stone
Soothes and relaxes for  better focus
Fun gift idea for a low price
cons: Some buyers complained that various toy parts broke too easily or toy didn't meet their expectations

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Fidget Cube, but Does Make Noise
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fidget cube. I have a lot of nervous energy and bought it, thinking it might help me focus. Honestly, it does not help me personally focus on anything but the cube, but that may just be me. I like the rolling dials, sliding switches and the rocker switch on the cube a lot. That being said, if you or anyone who will be around you while you are using this cube are bothered by repetitive noises, please see my video review here for what the different parts of this cube sound like. The noises are not loud, but you can definitely hear them.
customer_reviews.author: TexasG

customer_reviews.title: Never boring, there are so many pieces to interact with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fidget dodecagon for my son who is 1 so that he can learn about switches, buttons, etc. So far he loves it! It has been multiple days and he's been carrying this around the house, I think it's his new favorite toy. I even like playing with it when he isn't using it. It keeps him very distracted. The colors are true to the picture and it will fit almost entirely in one adult hand. I've seen some complaints about how loud the buttons are, but while you can hear the buttons when clicked, it hasn't been a problem for us.
customer_reviews.author: Elsbeth

customer_reviews.title: Highschool student loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This item caught my eye as something a high school student would enjoy playing with, and it could help him relieve stress as well. Correct on both counts. Highschool student loves it! He wouldn't even share it with his friends because he couldn't stop fidgeting the fidget toy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 24 hours, and I love it. It fits well in the hand, though it's larger than I expected. I feel like it would be obtrusive in a meeting unless you can keep your hands under the table the whole time. I was concerned that the little loop would not be enough to help me keep hold of it, but it's stretchy and works well. I think I will get the most use of this when I am a passenger in a car, while watching tv, and while reading.
customer_reviews.author: Kirra

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fisget toy I've ever got. I got white one. It has everything that keeps me busy and focused. I have relatively small hands, but it's small enough that fit in my hand perfectly. The clicking sound is very crisp. Others are very quiet. Tge shape allows to play with play with more than two sides at oncw or easily switch to one another. I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: 0 REGRETS!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is on the spectrum. He usually twists his beard (ruining it), but this is perfect. There’s so much to do with it. There’s something for everyone. When I get nervous, I use it, too. I love how it feels, so many options. It’s a little bigger than I had hoped, because I wanted to put it on a keychain for him, but it’s so nice, sleek, and aesthetically appealing.. I really don’t care. Can’t believe I found this for only $9!!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very well made with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of features to suit different peoples fidgeting. All the features are well made and function well. It is very well made. I find with my anxiety I like different functions at different times. I even like the silicone handle strap. Each feature is well designed and well made. Mine bounces around on my keychain and I have had no problems with it. While it has all kinds of features that all work well, it does make it a bit large to hold comfortably in your hand (depending on the size of the hand). Overall though, I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Darkchylde72

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for Angel Tree. When it arrived we checked it out and it's a very entertaining toy! Lots of things to "fidget" with. My kids want to order one to have at home. Hopefully the child that we bought it for enjoys it for a long time as much as we did for just a few minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our soon-to-be 8-yr-old son loves his fidget cube. He struggles with anxiety and mild ADHD and decided he wanted a calming box for his birthday. The fidget cube was one of the items we put in it and he plays with it all the time. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Moody

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fidgety boss
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my former boss/friend and he used it constantly. He kept telling me how much he loved it (after some ribbing on me getting him an ADHD toy). It was a good size and shape to just hold in the hand and press the knobs and buttons. I'm tempted to get one for my husband now as a stress-reliver.
customer_reviews.author: Neyv

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Says on the Tin
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of stuff for anxiety on the Dodecahedron, arrived un damaged. The only thing is the information pamphlet is written in broken English, however, with a little effort, you can make out what it says. Oh, and the pictures on the pamphlet are in poor light. Possibly do to the black-and-white printing. But with time and a little effort, I identified all twelve items and their functions.
customer_reviews.author: WardenofMagick

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy and alleviates my need to fidget!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for fidgeting and also a funny conversation starter / thing to pass around friends. I wish the joystick clicked, but that's just about my only issue. The sliders aren't too easy nor difficult to slide. Different buttons click at different volumes, for example the flat spinner that doubles as a button quick is quiet enough to click in class. Also, the switch is pretty loud, but satisfying as a result. My personal favorite part is the squishy flick thing. You can flick it as well as press it down and I love it! It doesn't feel cheap. It doesn't feel very expensive, but it definitely doesn't feel cheap. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: LadyC

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty great
customer_reviews.text: I needed this a lot in college algebra. The class was so boring and I had the worst teacher. I was constantly getting distracted by other things and my fingers were always messing with other stuff until I got this thing! It kept me focused and on task! Some people use it just for fun others use it to help pay attention. I think it works for both!
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Love it. But not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ADD toy I've found. I got it to stop twisting up paper clips at my desk at work. Unfortunately three days after my return window closed one of the squish guys broke off. Generally speaking the rubber buttons pop off. Etc. which is too bad cause I love it. It defenetwly wouldn't stand up to abuse. You have to be gentle with it.
customer_reviews.author: ZephiesGirl

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected, nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Really neat little alternative to the six sided fidget cube. This is about the size of a billiards ball, maybe a little smaller, and very lightweight but well made. A couple of the “fidgets” are a little redundant, but I think it’ll be a great gift for my kindergarten age son and harder to lose than the standard fidget cube.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than it looks, clicks can be noisey, still good
customer_reviews.text: If you're familiar with the fidget cubes, then this thing is actually going to surprise you. It's so much bigger than I thought it would be. Feels a lot sturdier too. It has plenty of options though I do wish some of the clicky buttons were just a tad bit quieter (only reason this is 4 stars). But it's a great value and offers lots of ways to keep your hands busy for not a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Fidget Cube
customer_reviews.text: I use this Fidget Dodecagon while stuck in rush hour traffic, just to keep in one hand and not attack my fingers. Works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: If you Fidget, you need this cube!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Fidget cube as a gift. My son recognized that his friend needed something to do with his hands. It is a good quality for a low price and it does the job well to help kids/people that need something to do with their hands. It has the finger loop so kids won't drop. I would highly recommend purchasing this product if you are looking for a Fidget cube!
customer_reviews.author: Lilsis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a fidget cube replacement
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a fidget cube that vanished (my money’s on the cats, but he thinks maybe he accidentally left it at his office). He has ADHD and finds long work days difficult to focus through, so I decided to replace his cube with this since we can’t find it. It’s bigger than I expected, about the size of a fist, but it’s got so many different things to try! It’s perfect for him. He showed it off on Zoom and Discord, and immediately two of his coworkers and one of his friends went to buy their own! It’s been a week or two since it was purchased and with some heavy use, it’s not worn out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I love this one
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ! I love this one . The pink and purple mini is perfect and it’s nice and silent too. Better than that cube I got I update ’ve barely used it and one of the three metal Balls has mostly stopped moving :(
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Bebies

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun, novel toy. I purchased it as something of a stress reliever for my youngest son, who is 7 and has autism. It helps give him something to do during long car rides. Perhaps sadly, within just one day part of it had broken off. Two weeks later, several other pieces have broken off. I expected much better durability for what I had paid. That said, it did do well to distract him, and he seemed to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: T Olsen

customer_reviews.title: My absolute FAVORITE of dozens of fidgets, can’t put it down!
customer_reviews.text: I have dozens of different fidgets and I can’t put this one down! I love the clicking! YES! Several click but that’s what I wanted! But I can take it with me because it does have some options that are silent when around people too. A perfect choice for everyone! I’m a senior citizen with anxiety and an intense need to keep my hands occupied. This is the answer to my problem! I plan to order several more to keep in my car, handbag and around my home in case I lose one.
customer_reviews.author: Coco & Tag

customer_reviews.title: Great Texture but A Bit Large...
customer_reviews.text: A lot larger than I expected but great nonetheless. This is not very subtle but in private or in situations where using something like this is not minded then it is lovely, it kept my hands busy and my mind focused on the tasks at hand! The textures are excellent quality and the responsiveness of the clicking buttons is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kia L.

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The soft rubber loop arrived broken and the largest silver ball does not roll smoothly and seems to be scraping against something inside. I'll probably have to cut the loop off so it won't bother me but I don't know what to do about the ball; that was one of the fidgets that I would have used a lot. It seems like some of the other fidgets are too loose or too tight as well, like the textured sliding button and the three rolling gears.
customer_reviews.author: L.E.E. Family

customer_reviews.title: Great but not so sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew (who is on the spectrum and has severe anxiety) and he seems to enjoy it. It’s bigger than I thought it would be (it’s as big as my palm so my nephew’s little hands are definitely full when holding it). There’s definitely a lot going on with it though (so many sides!), so be forewarned it’s easy for kiddos with sensory issues to get overwhelmed. Overall a great little gadget. Edit: one of the slide bars has already popped off. Natural to expect from a 10 year old boy, but I was hoping for something to last a little bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Interesting fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool, lots of stuff to do on it, The controller stick was a nice touch. My kid chewed off the rubber ball things tho. Other than those the rest is pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: NekroG

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for school kids with challenges
customer_reviews.text: Using five of these in elementary school classrooms. It especially works well with students who have been identified with autism or ADHD.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Slawson

customer_reviews.title: ... wish it was a little quieter but it's a pretty nice cube
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a little quieter but it's a pretty nice cube. I'd recommend for adults though because it's bigger so it's about the right size for my hand but would probably be too big for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Karrington

customer_reviews.title: Fun and cool toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my five year old client who suffers with maladaptive behaviors and anxiety. This is used as a stress coping skill device. Immediately upon opening and trying out he accidentally broke one of the knobs. Fortunately it was easy to fix. He thinks it's fun and entertaining and it does the trick to calm him down. This would be a great device for any child who anxiety in the car or is bored out and about during appointments. I would just be very careful for choking hazards as small parts may fall off. With any toy supervise your small children.
customer_reviews.author: G-Faith

customer_reviews.title: One was cheap the other was good quality
customer_reviews.text: So wen I got dis item I was like dis is so different then wat I expected but a piece fell out and then it broke in half so my brother gave me his and it was great to have so I guess twenty four dollars was spent on one piece of junk and one really good quality one so that is why I gave it a four star instead of a zero
customer_reviews.author: Allnutts

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable Enough for Kids
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this dodecagon because it sold itseld as "for children". Within the first few days, however, one of the buttons pressed entirely into the face of the toy, and not long after that the balloon-like heads on another face broke off entirely too easy creating a choking risk. It's a novel toy and was especially helpful when we needed it as a distraction but it's not even close to the level of durable needed to survive days with children. Also, if you are getting this for anyone young enough to still be putting things in their mouth I would encourage you to avoid it or only allow play while supervised.
customer_reviews.author: MC2

customer_reviews.title: impressive fidget cube
customer_reviews.text: daughter loves this toy. i played with it myself and have only minor tweaks i would have made to the design, like making things click or having resistance. it's a great little fidget cube, and everyone who sees it loves it. great value!
customer_reviews.author: J Cloud

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: very good toy for kids my son loves it so much bright color and light weight
customer_reviews.author: yukiko

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I dunno if others just got faulty product or are too rough on their toys. I do know my kids and I are really rough on toys and this thing hasn't had a single break. It's been on the floor. Dropped. Pulled and thoroughly abused. Still in one piece. I bought it because I have a fidgety kid and we do homeschool lessons. It helps him focus to have something in his hand that he can play with.
customer_reviews.author: ACruz

customer_reviews.title: Its way too big and overwhelming for a boy with a toddler's mind.
customer_reviews.text: The autistic kid I bought it for put it down after 30 seconds. I bought it as a distraction cuz he's 8 and still sucks his thumb. He gets bored after about 30 seconds and starts sucking his thumb again. This is supposed to be a help to autistic or ADHD children but this 8, going on 3, year old seems to be overwhelmed by the amount of bells and whistles on it. Maybe make it more simple for those who aren't all there?? Good idea?? I thought so. Good talk.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Huntsucker

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options! Very cool style cube!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat fidget cube with lots of sensory options! Seems well made, but my kiddo figured out how to pop a couple pieces off on day 2. They put them back on, and don't pull as hard now. Very interesting with lots of options. Very cool color choices too. We chose the black with lots of colors on it and it looks great! UPDATE: After a few days of play a piece came off. Then another. And another. Then it was lost. Unfortunately, it didn't hold up enough for me to order another one. ☹
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea in Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: Great Busy Toy for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I love this little ball—it was a present for a little boy and it’s great for helping him wind down for naps. There is so much to do on this ball for children. I think an adult would lose interest quickly, though it is fun to play with at first. The pink/maroon button pops off, making it a choking hazard. I simply removed the button and gave the ball back to the small child. Everything else seems well-on. Edit: the sliding buttons came off too
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: broke within 3 days
customer_reviews.text: while barely playing with it a handful of times, on the third day after it arrived, 5 buttons already broke or fell off. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I'm deaf, so not sure about the noise level, but I love this thing! my favorite side is probably the three mini metal balls or the three gears Dropped it a few times, no problems so far. I've been using the silicone loop as something to flick, not putting any weight on it and so far have not had any of the troubles talked about in previous reviews. it's a nice size and fits well into my curled up palm. 5/5 I'm probably going to buy some of these to give out to friends for their birthdays
customer_reviews.author: Karen Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Broken already
customer_reviews.text: Broken within 2 days of use. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Work
customer_reviews.text: It’s about the size of a standard stress ball and takes a little to find where it’s comfy in your hand but I love it. I do a lot of research at work and predominantly use my right hand and keeping my left busy with so many things to play with helps me from picking at my cuticles and making repetitive noises of motions. The buttons and joysticks are still relatively quiet for what they are
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Broken two ways in less than two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for less than a week before the pull part was pulled off. Another few days and the blue button popped off and my son sliced his finger open.
customer_reviews.author: Kehr

customer_reviews.title: Read below
customer_reviews.text: So I only gave this two stars and I feel like maybe it should be 3 stars. I got this for my son to put in his pocket to fidget with in class when he starts feeling antsy. It is way bigger than i thought it would be and its very loud. You cant fidget with this thing without it making a BUNCH of loud noise that is why i rated it so low. Other than that it is a good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel kuehne

customer_reviews.title: Cute & colorful.
customer_reviews.text: We like it a lot. I bought it for my husband, who is bed-ridden. He really likes it. This is the first fidget cube we have ever had - our granddaughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Not toddler proof
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter to fidget with during computer class work videos because they're long and she gets antsy however within a few days of having it my toddler got a hold of it and half the buttons were able to be pulled right off. Super disappointed. and he's only two so it's not like he was pulling with any kind of force.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Adams

customer_reviews.title: Grounding tool
customer_reviews.text: I really love this fidget toy. I noticed myself getting amped up due to my midterms coming up. I knew if I bought a fidget toy it would help me stay more grounded when studying. It even works great while driving. So far so good. I noticed my stress depleted when I play with it while studying, helps me stay focused. I don’t know if I’m using all the little gadgets properly but either way I still have fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gimino

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than it looks!
customer_reviews.text: I didnt look at the size specifications so I was pleasantly surprised with the size when I got it. My 10year old daughter has adhd and I have a hard time keeping her still when she is reading. This little thing is wonderful. My 12 year old wants one now too, just for fun. I find myself using it when I pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelymiri

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: my kid has anxiety this works very well for her. she is 5 so i know she will eventually destroy it i will be getting another one as many as it takes. it has so many sides that are relaxing and interactive. the multi-color very attractive for kids. fits in hand comfortable. this fidget covers almost all kind if feel and texture that any one can think of. i have never seen her on one toy for an hour like this fidget. ill be getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son has fidget spinners but lost interest in the quick. His favorite thing to do is click the back of remote controls, and now none of them stay on the remote. Saw this and gave it a try. Its his go to now when he just can't keep his hands still. Its also helping him to not pick at his nails. Great item for a kid who just can't keep their hands still, we use it during his virtual learning to keep him focused on what he needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.  Doesnt satisfy fidgeters
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and a few other fidget toys for my father in law who has alzheimers and likes to push buttons. This one was his least favorite. The switches and buttons dont move much and were hard to manipulate. It seems very cheaply made. Regifted to my 2 year old niece who didnt like it either. For the money, definitely better options in the fidget market.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dundee

customer_reviews.title: So satisfying. Friggin love it. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! My friends and I were all playing with it last night. It's very satisfying and calming for people with anxiety or a little stoned. Several sides have multiple features, some of them wiggle twist and click. Some sides make noises it's very satisfying. I bought this for my boyfriend's kid but I'm probably going to keep it in my car when there's traffic lol. I bought the larger size and it's definately safe for tots, if you have the strength to give it to them and not just keep playing with it endlessly
customer_reviews.author: bucketsof blood

customer_reviews.title: Great Fidget Cube!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new fidget cube. This one has more sides and things to click on. He has ADHD and is allowed to bring this to school to help him focus on school. He concentrates better when he has something in his hands. This is a perfect size, the other cubes are too small. The black and red colors are his favorite because it looks like something technical rather then a small child’s toy. He’s in 2nd grade. I’d your child likes fidget cubes, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: chi town mom

customer_reviews.title: Totally Not for Toddlers Choking Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Ok it’s obviously not meant for a two year old but my toddler enjoys his fisher price fidget cube so much in the car, that I thought I’d get him a better one for a plane ride. It’s great but those 3 little emoji face balls broke right off. Luckily I was watching my toddler when it happened or it could’ve become a choking hazard. I threw the fidget dodecagon away after that happened to prevent further issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Excoriation Disorder
customer_reviews.text: I live with excoriation disorder, also known as dermatillomania. It’s compulsive skin picking. I’ve tried so many different things to keep my hands busy so I don’t pick when I’m bored, but especially when I’m anxious. My husband has a dodger spinner, which I tried, but it didn’t help. This has multiple types of things I can fiddle with and keep my hands busy so I don’t create more scars.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Bigger than your palm
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! You cannot put it in your pocket, it is not discreet, and bigger than the palm of your hand, even as an adult. However, be as that may, each sensory side is functional and works as intended. The product seems to be made of quality material that is not thin and has a nice matte finish and feel. 1 star is knocked off due to sheer sizing alone. Will see the longevitiy of it.
customer_reviews.author: luna

customer_reviews.title: Good for fidgety or ADHD kids
customer_reviews.text: My son is extremely hyper and this keeps his attention a little better than the cube version. It's larger and brightly colored so it helps with finding it when it invariable gets lost in the car/under furniture. The name is incorrect though. As a nerd, I have to point out this is a dodecahedron, not a dodecagon. Dodecagons are two dimensional, dodecahedrons are three.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It’s cheap
customer_reviews.text: No stars really ... Broke in the first hour we fixed it but keeps breaking should have returned it .. but we keep fixing it not for young child more like 10 year olds .. how ever they get board of it fast .. if it were made well I would say more for a 2-5 year old .
customer_reviews.author: todd

customer_reviews.title: Good before it’s broken
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product...for the first week. I received this excited to use in the office during the long days. I get antsy sitting all day so I figured it would help. Within 2 days the joystick part broke inside and became detached. I asked for a refund and then ordered a new one with amazon and they waived expediting shipping; which was great. I got the second one and I’ve had it for about a week and now the toggle on/off switch did the same thing. Feels like it’s broken internally somehow. Waste of money but oh well; you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Perona

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and 2 broke within a week
customer_reviews.text: My son bought one and the joystick was broken when he got it. Got a replacement only to have it for 5 hours and have one of the silicon bulbs break off in his hand. These are not well made. If you have a differently abled person that you are buying this for, this is not the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: My 11 y/o is a fidgeter. He needed something to keep his hands busy. This thing is so cheaply made it fell apart after the second time he used it. Trash can now owns a fidget dodecagon.
customer_reviews.author: my3bryboys

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! CHOKING HAZARD!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and the side with the 3 switch buttons came off very easily.. I'm glad I was supervising my son while he was fidgeting with this and was shocked as to how easily they came off. This is a choking hazard if you are not watching like a hawk! Returning this immediately. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carito

customer_reviews.title: Durable, not best for small kids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my kids to occupy them on flight. This was not intended for children per description, but I took my chances. Well made, was thrown on ground several times & only 2 pieces came off (the sliders) but I was able to put back on (small parts easily swallowed). Was really hoping my kiddo would enjoy this more, saving until he gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped my hair pulling!
customer_reviews.text: I used to pull out my hair due to nervousness and concentration. So in school i would leave really big piles of hair that i pulled out and i would get really embarrassed. people would ask me if it was a nervous condition and i would get really self conscious about it. but every since i bought this fidget toy, everytime i read or do homework or do something that requires concentration, i play with this instead and it stopped me from pulling my hair out altogether
customer_reviews.author: viviana

customer_reviews.title: Glad to finally have something that stops me from biting my fingers at work!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty awesome, not gonna lie. It’s got all kinds of options for various people. I took it to work for two days before writing this- so it endured roughly 16 hours in my hands. It’s durable, fits in the hand really nicely, the buttons aren’t too loud, and the “handle” bit is made of silicone (not plastic like I thought) and it’s amazing. It lets you spin it as if it were on a string. So I’m super pleased with it. Glad to finally have something that keeps me from biting my fingers at work!
customer_reviews.author: Max B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good for keeping my hands busy!
customer_reviews.text: Some buttons on this thing make an audible click and to be honest, that helps a lot. I really like having a clicking noise when I spam the button, even if it eventually annoys me. When I get annoyed, I just move on to another part of it. There are so many things to do and I've only had this thing for a day but I really love it. Can't say anything about the durability yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron L.

customer_reviews.title: Lots to figit!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 yr old grandson really wanted this, as he has a long wait time after school. He liked all the items to play with on each surface. I like that it is his palm size and not tiny. I think it will last; it seems to be well-made. He chose from all available colors. Always nice to have choices!
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: So, it's big. That's not a bad thing for me, but might be a problem for some. One of the sliders popped off on day one, but I was able to push it back on. It was a big hit though, there were a few people interested in it
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Krammer

customer_reviews.title: Letdown. 1. It's huge, 2. It's not even great
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this thing is HUGE. It may mention that in the product details but I assumed it was something smaller that I could put in my pocket and fidget with. No, it's the size of a tennis ball. What am I supposed to do with that? And the fidget options arent even great. I liked maybe two of the ten options. All around a let down for something with such great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, could be more durable
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old with ADHD broke two sides of this with normal use. One side being the joystick, which was his favorite. Great idea though and when he would pick at his fingers, I would give this to him and he would be the perfect replacement.
customer_reviews.author: mallory

customer_reviews.title: Great for anxiety-relief
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a family member and it keeps him calm. Helps him deal with his anxiety and hyperactivity which causes him to have seizures (anxiety increases his risk for seizures). Great little cube of distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a behavioral therapist
customer_reviews.text: My friend is a behavioral therapist and wanted these to gift to the families whom she works with. The kids come from different backgrounds including ADHD or ASD. They love it, and call it their favorite toy that is on par with their Minecraft and lego collection. Glad these simple things can make a kid smile and shine.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lebroski

customer_reviews.title: FAIL.
customer_reviews.text: The person receiving this gift was more amused by the bad translations in the directions than actually fidgeting with it. FAIL. I have to admit. The translation is so bad, in a spot or two, you're not real sure what they were trying to say.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first “fidget” product I have ever purchased. Personally, it helps me very much at times when I am anxious or stressed. This object is larger than I imagined, but it does fit into my palm. Beware that this product can be loud, but there are certain features that are very quiet or silent altogether. There are so many options on this product. My favorite are the buttons and switch button. I like to keep this in my purse or in my car for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Its too loud
customer_reviews.text: As a student with ADHD I think this product has is strengths and weaknesses. It has lot of different textures, different buttons, and switches to help keep overactive minds on task. One major draw back it that most of buttons and switches make a loud clicking sounds that is not ideal for a classroom setting.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a few minutes. I bought this for my 4 year old thinking it would help her to sit still. After playing with it foyer a few minutes she broke it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good until breaking
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that this fidget had lots of sides and options. Very good for a person with anxiety/ADHD, such as myself. However, it is rather large and hard to hold in my hand at times. Also, the on/off button broke after less than 24 hours and very little use, which was quite disappointing. If this button had not broken, I would give it 4 stars at least. However, the fact that it broke in less than 24 hours is sad. About a week later the purple loop broke as well. The photo shows the size and the video shows how the button is not working correctly and also how the fidget rattles a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea D.

customer_reviews.title: The small pieces do come off, but not terrible quality. Great for travel.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber pieces do come off, so please watch your kids with it, but this is a great thing to keep a toddler occupied on a plane when it is new. Now, my toddler uses it to “turn on tv or shows”. Lol. Still a great use for the trip I bought it for. But please watch for the pieces that come off easily. Choking hazard for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great for fidgety hands
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to fidget around when I can not stay still. This is a good product and is what it is described. However, the packaging it came in was smashed and the item was randomly in a bagged package. This could have occurred throughout shipping. Maybe they need to package the product a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but not the most durable
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great. There is something for everyone with all of the sides. It’s quieter than other fidget cubes I’ve had. My main problem is that within 3 days of use and it’s already falling apart. I’ve lost 3 pieces and it’s not like I’m abusing it or anything. Disappointed because it really was a cool idea.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: It showed up on time. Bigger then I expected. My son loves it. The only disapointing thing is, the volume sliding button/knobs can and do fall off. They are small. So I'd advise not to let small children to play with this.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Stress Reliever
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter. She visited during Christmas but had to fly back on Christmas day due to her job. The airports are very stressful to her. She suffers from panic attacks. This helped her a lot. It kept her from going into a full blown panic attack. So yes I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Anxiety and PTSD
customer_reviews.text: I like how many things I can do with it. It helps with my PTSD when I get panicky or anxious. I was surprised however that it is much bigger than expected and I can’t rap my hand around it like most small fidget cubes but this one has a lot more so it’s to be expected that it will be a bit bigger to fit everything. Not a fan of the loop for transporting it since it just sticks out and doesn’t really have a purpose, but that’s just my own opinion.
customer_reviews.author: E&H

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for myself before i started ADHD treatment to try and help with anxiety due to my adhd but within the first couple of uses pieces started popping out and off and i wasn’t handling it rough. I will stick to regular fidget cube. I was excited about this one though
customer_reviews.author: Rarebreed79

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kiddos with ADHD!
customer_reviews.text: My son requested this for the 1st day of school, because he has ADHD and fidgets a lot. I purchased this for him to help keep him calm, and it worked! He loves it! He loves that it's not a boring color, and that it has plenty of gadgets to keep himself busy!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Click Review
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product! It's the perfect toy for my anxiety and I love all the options it has. I've attached a video so you can decide for yourself if the clicking is too loud but I don't mind it one bit!
customer_reviews.author: Bradie A.

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, make sure all pieces attached
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these (black/multi and blue/multi) but the blue one was missing one of the pieces. My son didn’t care and wanted to play with it so I opened the box, but it was a little disappointing. Other than that it’s a great little toy.
customer_reviews.author: K Cline

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Small pieces break off immediately!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my young autistic son. EVERY single piece that wasnt flat fell off and broke with ONE use. It just kept breaking and all the pieces breaking off were so so small and dangerous. I had to dig some out of my sons mouth that he picked up. We were so excited about this but this item was a very cheap and dangerous product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Fidgity
customer_reviews.text: It is actually bigger than I thought. About a fist size. It's really light and a little cheap feeling to get the gratification of a fidgit toy. But fir this price, probably better quality out there.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Tiernan

customer_reviews.title: Size was not what I expected and it broke right away
customer_reviews.text: This is really cute but the little buttons fell off with in one minute of my daughter playing with it. I gave it two stars because it is really cute and does have a lot of busy buttons. The size is far too big to put in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I do like this better than the common 6 sided cube one. Some of the pieces fell off fairly easily after a few uses but I could put them back on. I had to cut off the "loop" as students were putting their fingers inside it and swinging it. I do like it but it is a bit big.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a week
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a week and it broke. The plastic is to thin for someone who needs to keep there hands occupied. Great size and like everything on it. Breaks to easy
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, who is a non-stop fidgeter, and he loves it. In my opinion, the best part about it is the badly translated description, which provides entertainment for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: The joystick piece broke
customer_reviews.text: The joystick piece broke within 5 minutes of normal use. Other than that the other pieces are pretty nifty. If it was a little more resilient then I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: One of My Favorite Fidgets
customer_reviews.text: I am autistic and have found this fidget very helpful in managing my anxiety. The buttons can be quite noisy (as expected). I do not personally enjoy clicking sounds, but auditory seekers may find the clicks soothing. I tend to constantly seek tactile input and love this fidget because of the many different tactile sensations and textures it provides. This is certainly one of my favorite fidgets for tactile input due to this variety. This product arrived on time and is as described. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for kids needing something in hands.
customer_reviews.text: All of my kids need to have something in their hands to stay occupied. This toy suits their desire to fidget! Although, the knobs broke in bag while we were traveling it still functions for their needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: Larger toy, lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fidgety fun to be had with this. It’s quite large, like palm sized, which I wasn’t expecting, but that’s been fine. Came with seasonal key chain which we gave as a stocking stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy on the hands, super helpful to keep hands/fingers busy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim because my SO had been saying she wanted a fidget cube. I have big hands, so I know how sore and frustrating small items are in the hands. I got her the biggest figdet thing I could find, and it did not disappoint. It's still by the couch, used every day, and she loves it. Don't pull too hard on the little rubber faces though :)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I solely purchased this item to keep my young toddler busy. He loves to click the buttons on this sensory toy. I like that it has a few clickers and texture so my son can spend time being distracted with the clicker and the texture of the cube.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had found the perfect fidget toy for my 6 year old special needs nephew, but one of the buttons pops off with little effort making this an extreme choking hazard for him. I did come back and read the product page again and see there is a choking hazard listed, but the button should not pop off this easily. Even for myself to use I would feel upset that the one function breaks so easily. Super disappointed. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but broke one item in first hour after we used it.
customer_reviews.text: Great item, But one item on one side broke in first couple hours. So it is Not very sturdy. Still great item. If you will improve quality will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Roscovan
